review_text: River access(sort of) could definitely use some safety signs next to the water since it's right in town. Very nice mode. Trail through the bottoms.

They have good educational programs about the outdoors. The center is accessible with a new wheelchair lift      The Alan E. Rich Environmental Park is just down the street and the Millers River Blue Trail starts here. There is an accessible dock for people with chalkenges to launch kayaks or canoes.
They have an awesome universal access dock for launching boats paddled from Athol Orange.
Nice facility, some interesting exhibits.
Beautiful place. A bunch of little scenic water holes, covered bridges, and dams
I've grown up around this river and I absolutely love it. It has some beautiful views and wildlife surrounding it.
Great kayaking and canoeing fishing etc

Nice wild life reservation, but there is a secret entrance I know of. Right in the middle of the entire project. Do have photos and directions but for now keeping to myself. Even has a small area for parking (free).
Because I was not there my x friends where. I can see why they must have been lost woods and sun....
Amazing scenic route.
Clean and pretty river.
Great fishing
Great views.  Major tourist attraction during leaf peeping season.
Good pla e to catch small mouth bass
It's a bridge.
I went to RPM FEST here and it was amazing. Good space. Lots of shady bits for the super pale folks like me.
response_from_owner_text: Thank you Saletha! RPM is one of our favorite events, great crowd!

review_text: Had our wedding reception here in 1990! All our families and friends! Rainy day but nonetheless we all had a great time! Nice place for any event! Ample parking and full bathroom facilities! Barbecue pit! Full bar! We had bobby C for our music!

Mutton and Mead faire is excellent as usual! We love coming to this annually.  Bring the whole family for lots of fun.  While the food is great too, try to bring some of your own so you don't spend a fortune.  Parking is in a vast field.  Highly recommend coming for the whole day and staying for the final pub sing.  If it's your thing, come dressed up (which has gained a lot of popularity in recent years).  So much fun for all ages, including jousting, knights, archery, clothing, fairies, the list goes on and on.
Went to Mutton and Mead - a renaissance fair. Great venue, a lot of fun, and awesome mead. Workers were very helpful offering to cart us from our car to the event
Great event area, lots of space for anything your planning.
It was a fun night of dancing with Bobby C and everyone working was SUPER nice. They even shared snacks when that wasn't part of deal!!
Great site.  Been here for Renaissance Faires and Heavy Metal festivals.  Very accommodating staff/members
response_from_owner_text: Thank you Kilean, we try our best!

review_text: Classic Rod and Gun club, supportive hosts, and a lovely site for events!

I had a great time white water rafting at Zoar Outdoor! It was well-organized and the guides were experienced and friendly. We had Brian as a guide and he was great! We did the Zoar gap trip this time, I would love to go back and do the dry run rapids next time. We also stayed at the Hawk Mountain lodge which was very convenient. We booked the Deerfield suite which was spacious and clean. The A/C was a portable unit and wasn't working very well. Other than that, there were no complaints. The staff was professional and helpful and we had a wonderful time!
response_from_owner_text: Hi Olivia, thanks so much for taking the time to share your experience! We're so glad that you had an amazing rafting with us, and we'd love to have you join us on the Dryway! We also wanted you to know that the A/C unit is on our radar, and we appreciate your feedback. Hope you have a great day!

review_text: We went zip lining today for the first time and had the time of our lives. The course is so awesome and the zips are a blast. The guides are incredible. We had Kyle and Viv and they absolutely ramped the experience up to the next level. Such a cool place and such a cool experience. Zoar absolutely rocks!!
response_from_owner_text: Hi Tyler! We're thrilled to hear that you had a blast zipping with Kyle and Viv! Thanks for taking the time to share your experience, we hope to see you back soon for more adventures!

review_text: We had such an amazing white water rafting trip on the Deerfield River with Zoar! Our group had wanted to do it for years and finally made it happen. Our guide Isaac was very knowledgeable and friendly and ensured we had a safe and enjoyable experience. It made for a great kick off to our girls weekend. Highly recommend Zoar Outdoor, and a big thank you to Isaac!
response_from_owner_text: Hi Angela! We're so glad you had a great time kicking off your girls weekend on the river with us! Thanks for sharing your experience, we hope to see you all back for more adventures!

review_text:
On Sunday June 9, 2024 our entire family, a group of 14 ranging in ages from 10-75 gathered at Zoar Outdoor to celebrate my husband's 75th birthday.
Our guides, Bailey, Jen, Kate and Wayne were professional, knowledgeable, patient but best of all so much fun!
The afternoon was filled with exhilarating zip lining, breath-taking scenery and lots of laughs.
A truly memorable experience was had by all.
Thank You.
response_from_owner_text: Hi Chris! We're thrilled that your family had such a great time celebrating your husband's birthday! Thank you so much for your kind words, we're so happy that our guides were able to create a memorable experience for you all. We hope to see you again for more adventures!

review_text: We did the half-day rafting adventure.  My wife was very anxious about participating, but within minutes of starting the trip she was thoroughly enjoying the experience thanks to our AMAZING guide, Tera!  She was knowledgeable and confident and had lots of great information to share along the trip.  There were 6 of us, Grandparents, Parents, and Teens, so we had our own raft.  It was the highlight of our week in the Berkshires.  Everyone involved with Zoar was patient, knowledgeable and upbeat!  They have an terrific staff.  I highly recommend this experience when you are visiting the Berkshires!

A Great time! Myself and my two teens had great time on the zip line adventure! Our Guides, were very informative and relaxed at the same time. It was welcoming atmosphere where we felt safe. The zips start easy and never get hard but end up longer and faster.  Great for beginners and  experienced zippers alike!
response_from_owner_text: Hi Mike! We are so happy to hear you had such an amazing time ziplining with your family! Thanks for taking the time to share your experience. We hope to have  you back to do some more adventuring with us!

review_text: Even though it ended up being an overcast and slightly rainy day, we had a great time! Our guide Tera was the best!! Since this was our first time rafting, we took the class II with one class III rapid adventure, but next time it'll be the III-IV. Very thankful that we managed to stay ahead of the dam release which if we had started much later could have been a disappointment, but the timing worked out perfect. Another note, this adventure package said that it came with lunch, and we expected very basic sandwiches and maybe a bag of chips, but they definitely over-delivered with great selections and taste! And tasty homemade cookies! Thank you!
response_from_owner_text: Hi Tracy! We're so happy to hear you had such an amazing time rafting with Tera. Thanks for taking the time to share your experience on the Gap, we can't wait to see you again for the Dryway!

review_text: My daughter and I visited Zoar Outdoor today for ziplining.  It was my daughters first time and my second time visiting.  We had the best time ever!!!!  Thank you to Kyle,  Bailey and Aidan for making our trip so much fun.  Lots of good laughs   I highly recommend Zoar Outdoor.  They are packed full of adventures.
response_from_owner_text: Hi, thank you for your wonderful review! We appreciate you coming back to visit us and bringing your daughter along for the adventure! So happy to hear that you had a blast with Kyle, Bailey, and Aidan. We look forward to seeing you again in the future!

review_text: Great verity of coffee pots.
Good fishing
Well kept trails. Thank God for the Nordic Center after a hot and humid hike. Worth checking out. Looks like more fun for snowshoeing and winter cross country.

Bring bug spray!!! The visitor center is closed, but the trails are open. If your kids like easy hiking trails, these will fulfill that. The trails are rated for skiing, not hiking. The moderate trail wasn't very steep, though some might have issues. Didn't try the black trails. Not much at the top, but a good roundabout hike of a couple hours. Biggest plus, no road noise or loud city sounds to break up the beauty.
Lots of ticks right now but I have enjoyed these trails for years and we slide and snowshoe . Great place for a calm day outside
This is a nice spot to hike around, lots of trail options to choose from. Please be aware that the visitor center is closed due to Covid-19 restrictions being in place.
Very nice and clean. Easy trails, my 4 yearold stepson was able to complete it.
Well kept trails. Trails are good for all ages and abilities. Big parking lot. Good for kids.
Great place to walk in the woods with your dog hitting the trails.
Nice place to walk and charge up your car at the same time.

Sitting at the convergence of the Connecticut and Millers rivers, this is  place dreams are made of. You have the perfect view of the French King Bridge and the Millers bridge. Bring your kids or the love of your life (or of the month), and take it in. No regrets (alrhough snakes and ticks could be part of the experience).

Drove about an hour to this spot to get a nice shot of the French King bridge from underneath but I had no idea there was this little cute spot! Grass area for picnics, little beach with some rocks to climb. Very cute spot, have to come back here in the summer. Good area for some quiet time.

This is also known as the "Jumping Bridge" to a lot of locals.

Cabot's Camp, and it's much more popular bridge, is a great summer day location. The old building can't, normally, be toured, but still looks nice with it's age. The property has a couple micro beaches giving way to the Connecticut on the north side of the property. The beaches and rocks near them are some decent fishing or chilling spots (Also great for pictures of the French King) Parking is ample and the site is relatively clean, minus the parking lot which can be totally trashed by partying teens and scavenging animals.

The bridge offers a great area for recreation as the deeper Millers River is pulled under it on the way to the Connecticut River down the bank. The jumping is great and is often flooded by locals during the hotter days. It again, just like the beach, offers a great picture opportunity of the bridge.

The whole property is easily accessible all year round via Dorsey Rd or most of the year via East Mineral Rd

Pros:
- Great swim spot at the bridge
- Great chill spot at the beach
- Great fishing spot at the rocks
- Great for pictures everywhere
- Ample parking
- Cool old building

Cons:
- Trash in the parking lot
- Dodgy access during winter on East Mineral Rd
- During spring, the bridge will get muddy
A truly hidden gem giving amazing View of the French King Bridge. Guess it's not that popular among visitors as the place was really remote and pristine.
Nice little spot for a picnic in your car watching the river. Fishing.
My granddaughter wanted to go magnet fishing although it's cold we gave it a go and got a old rusty nail and old rusty tack...

I've come here many times and there's always ticks here sadly. We had a small cooler and we set it on the ground and within a few minutes it had 5 ticks crawling on it. I've only gotten ticks here in my whole life, maybe just bad luck but be careful. Besides that it's a great place for a short walk and fishing.
This place is worth the stop to see, swim, fish, boat...I just wish we could find contact for rentals/overnight. Great spot for a wedding, don't you think?
